sentence.Network_en: He denounced the decision to invite his fellow archbishop to preach.
sentence.Network_cn: 他痛斥了邀请其他大主教同仁布道的决定。
他大喊道：“不要对我说教。”

sentence.Network_en: He realized that his calling was to preach the gospel.
sentence.Network_cn: 他体悟到宣讲福音是他的使命。

jx.jx_en_mean: advocate something to people who already share one's convictions about its merits or importance
jx.jx_cn_mean: 向皈依者布道（对已经有信念者做宣传）

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French prechier, from Latin praedicare 'proclaim', in ecclesiastical Latin 'preach', from prae 'before' + dicare 'declare'

entry.def: When a member of the clergy preaches a sermon, he or she gives a talk on a religious or moral subject during a religious service.

example.ex: At High Mass the priest preached a sermon on the devil...
example.tran: 牧师在大弥撒上布道驱邪。

example.ex: The bishop preached to a crowd of several hundred local people...
example.tran: 主教向当地聚集的数百人布道。

entry.def: When people preach a belief or a course of action, they try to persuade other people to accept the belief or to take the course of action.

example.ex: The Prime Minister said he was trying to preach peace and tolerance to his people...
example.tran: 首相表示他在竭力向他的人民宣传和平和宽容。

example.ex: Health experts are now preaching that even a little exercise is far better than none at all...
example.tran: 现在健康专家都在宣扬，即使是少量的运动也远比根本不运动好得多。

entry.tran: 说教；唠叨；不胜其烦地劝诫
entry.def: If someone gives you advice in a very serious, boring way, you can say that they are preaching at you.

example.tran: 他大喊道：“不要对我说教。”

entry.tran: 以身作则；身体力行；躬行己说
entry.def: If you say that someone practises what they preach, you mean that they behave in the way that they encourage other people to behave in.

example.ex: He ought to practise what he preaches.

entry.tran: 向教徒传道（表示向已经接受某种思想的人宣传这种思想）
entry.def: If you say that someone is preaching to the converted, you mean that they are wasting their time because they are trying to persuade people to think or believe in things that they already think or believe in.

sentences.sentence: "The minister is not preaching this Sunday"

means.word_mean: 2. speak, plead, or argue in favour of;

sentences.sentence: "The doctor advocated a smoking ban in the entire house"

auth_sentence.content: You two continue to preach on this message board.
auth_sentence.res_content: You two continue to preach on this message board.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You two continue to preach on this message board.

auth_sentence.content: He said preach the Gospel to every creature.
auth_sentence.res_content: He said preach the Gospel to every creature.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He said preach the Gospel to every creature.

auth_sentence.content: Did they really understand and preach the truth?
auth_sentence.res_content: Did they really understand and preach the truth?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Did they really understand and preach the truth?

means.word_mean: 布道，讲道（尤指教堂中礼拜时）

sentences.en: He felt very tired, for he preached for a long time.
sentences.cn: 由于讲道太久, 他感觉非常疲劳。

sentences.en: The man was preaching the Gospel.
Christ preached that we should love each other.
sentences.cn: 基督在布道中说人们应该互爱。

sentences.en: It is not the author's business to preach, but to give a real, historical picture of life.
sentences.cn: 作者的责任不在于说教, 而在于展现一幅真实的具有历史意义的生活画面。

sentences.en: The old man preached temperance to young people.
sentences.cn: 那位老人劝年轻人戒酒。

sentences.en: She preached economy as the best means of solving the crisis.
sentences.cn: 她倡导说节约是解决危机的最佳方法。

jushi.english: He felt very tired, for he preached for a long time.
jushi.chinese: 由于讲道太久,他感觉非常疲劳。

jushi.english: We had to walk three miles to the church, where he preached.
jushi.chinese: 我们不得不步行3英里去他传教的教堂。
